logo_placement: Analyze the video and generate a single, combined observation about logo placement. Focus on logo prominence, size, orientation, position, and visibility across the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords related to logo placement.
resolution_quality: Examine the video and provide a single, combined observation on its resolution quality. Focus on clarity, sharpness, overall quality, and suitability for different formats. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords describing resolution quality.
color_palette: Analyze the color palette in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note dominant and accent colors, hues, tones, and saturation levels, focusing on mood or atmosphere. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords for dominant and accent colors.
visual_themes: Identify visual themes in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note emotional and stylistic tones like modern, rustic, futuristic, etc., considering the continuity across the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords for visual themes.
key_objects: Identify key objects in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Focus on object prominence, relevance, and contribution to the video's message. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords for key objects present.
people_attributes: Describe the people in the video, if any, and provide a single, combined observation. Focus on demographics, attributes, and alignment with the target audience throughout the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide a response in a single line with only comma-separated keywords for people attributes.
text_amount: Evaluate the text amount in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note text density, readability, and balance with visuals across the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide a response in a single line with only comma-separated keywords related to text density and readability.
text_overlay_style: Analyze the style of text overlays in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note font, color, placement, and effects as they appear in the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide a response in a single line with only comma-separated keywords describing text overlay style.
brand_integration: Observe brand integration in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note placements like foreground, background, embedded, or prominently displayed across the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords related to brand integration.
background_elements: Identify background elements in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note urban or natural scenes, abstract patterns, or textures and their impact across the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide a response in a single line with only comma-separated keywords for background elements.
vfx_elements: Identify visual effects (VFX) in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note CGI, 3D rendering, motion blur, overlays, filters, and effects used in the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords for visual effects.
layout_composition: Describe the layout and composition of the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note rule of thirds, symmetry, balance, framing, focal points, and layout type. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide a response in a single line with only comma-separated keywords for layout composition.
shot_type: Analyze the shot type in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note framing such as close-up, wide shot, and angle (eye-level, high-angle, etc.). Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords describing the shot type.
editing_style: Observe the editing style in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note transitions, color correction, filters, vignettes, and grain effects. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords for editing style.
camera_movement: Identify any camera movement suggested by the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note movement types like tracking, panning, tilting, or motion blur. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords for camera movement.
lighting_style: Describe the lighting style in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note natural, studio, high contrast, soft, harsh, backlighting, and ambient lighting across the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords for lighting style.
narrative_style: Analyze the narrative style in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note storytelling structures like testimonial, journey, humor, or suspense. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords describing the narrative style.
emotional_tone: Identify the emotional tone in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note moods like playful, joyful, dramatic, or nostalgic. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords describing the emotional tone.
cta_presence: Identify calls to action (CTAs) in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note CTA forms like button, text, or symbol, and engagement design across the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. If no CTA is present, return 'No CTA'. Provide only comma-separated keywords for call-to-action elements.
hook_presence: Examine any hooks in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Identify hooks like bold statements, emotional appeal, humor, or shock value across the video. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide a response in a single line with only comma-separated keywords describing the hook elements.
target_audience: Describe traits of the target audience based on the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note age, gender, cultural background, interests, and lifestyle. Provide a response in a single line with only comma-separated keywords for target audience traits.
cultural_relevance: Observe cultural relevance in the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note symbols, traditions, language, or themes meaningful to the target audience. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide a response in a single line with only comma-separated keywords for cultural references.
business_tags: Analyze the video and generate a single, combined set of contextual tags that are relevant from a business perspective. Identify keywords that relate to product features, services offered, brand values, industry sector, marketing campaign themes, competitive advantages, target market, unique selling propositions, and any relevant business strategies. Eliminate duplicate or redundant tags. Provide only comma-separated keywords related to business context.
product_tags: Analyze the video and generate a single, combined set of relevant tags that describe the key elements of the product. Focus on keywords related to the product type, brand, target audience, features, benefits, functionalities, materials, sizes, colors, usage occasions, design or aesthetic qualities, and any unique selling points. Eliminate duplicate or redundant tags. Provide only comma-separated keywords describing product features.
brand_cues: Examine brand integration from the video and provide some tags observation. Note brand cues like logo placement, product usage, or colors. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide only comma-separated keywords for brand cues.
platform_features: Identify platform-specific features in these frames from the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note aspect ratios, native elements, or platform-focused design choices. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide concise and unique keywords or short phrases only. Example Output: – Swipe up, mobile-friendly, native layout. List only comma-separated keywords for platform-specific features.
symbols_icons: Identify symbols, icons, or visual shorthand in these frames from the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note if they clarify meaning, enhance interest, or provide cultural references. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide concise and unique keywords or short phrases only. Example Output: – Icons, clear meaning, brand logo. List only comma-separated keywords describing symbols or icons.
depth_of_field: Observe depth of field in these frames from the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note shallow or deep focus, visual hierarchy, and focal emphasis. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide concise and unique keywords or short phrases only. Example Output: – Shallow focus, blurred background, subject highlight. List only comma-separated keywords for depth of field.
offer_promotion: Identify any offers or promotions in these frames from the video and provide a single, combined observation. Note elements like discounts, limited-time offers, or exclusivity. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide concise and unique keywords or short phrases only. Example Output: – Limited time, exclusive offer, 20% off. List only comma-separated keywords related to offers and promotions.
hook_binary: Examine these frames from the video to determine if there is a hook, such as an intriguing headline, emotional appeal, or other attention-grabbing elements. Respond with True if a hook is present, otherwise respond with False. Respond only with True or False.
offer_binary: Inspect these frames from the video for any indication of an offer or promotion, such as discounts, limited-time offers, or similar promotional elements. Respond with True if an offer or promotion is present, otherwise respond with False. Respond only with True or False.
cta_binary: Analyze these frames from the video and determine if a call to action (CTA) element, such as a button, text, or symbol prompting action, is present. Respond with True if a CTA is present, otherwise respond with False. Respond only with True or False.
interactivity_binary: Review these frames from the video to see if they suggest or encourage user interactivity, such as clickable elements or prompts. Respond with True if interactivity is suggested, otherwise respond with False. Respond only with True or False.
product_presence_binary: Examine these frames from the video and identify if there is a product featured. Respond with True if a product is visible, otherwise respond with False. Respond only with True or False.
logo_presence_binary: Analyze these frames from the video and determine whether there is a visible logo. Respond with True if a logo is present, otherwise respond with False. Respond only with True or False.
cta_specific: Identify any calls to action (CTAs) in these frames from the video and generate a single, combined observation. Specify if the CTA is in the form of text, button, or symbol, and describe its emphasis and design for engagement. Ensure the response eliminates duplicate or redundant observations. Provide concise and unique keywords or short phrases only. Example Output: – Bold text, large button, high contrast, click here. Respond only with True or False.
